RT @alexburnsNYT @nkulish In 2015, Center for American Progress researchers wrote a report on U.S. Islamophobia, w/a 4300-word chapter on the Bloomberg-era NYPD.

When the report was published, the chapter was gone.

By then, Bloomberg had given CAP ~$1.5mm. That number has grown.
https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/02/15/us/politics/michael-bloomberg-spending.html

I'm proud to partner with you in this fight, @JamilahLemieux! https://twitter.com/TeamWarren/status/1228874606104150016 QT @TeamWarren “[@ewarren] is an incredibly impressive candidate who has a plan to increase funding for HBCUs and other Minority-Serving Institutions by $50 billion and a plan to protect the right of women to make decisions about their reproductive lives.” -@JamilahLemieux http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EQ3TIrWW4AAvsQS.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1228870056672710657/vid/320x320/2feB1aCpGqKt23Rs.mp4?tag=13

@GuillermoCJr Thank you for volunteering this week, Guillermo!

William T. Coleman, Jr. broke enormous barriers as a Black lawyer in the civil rights era and the first Black Department of Transportation Secretary. I'm thrilled our bill to rename the Department of Transportation's HQ after him passed the Senate this week. #BlackHistoryMonth http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EQ2-1ybWoAAoieZ.jpg

Looking forward to joining @JesseBWatters on @FoxNews tonight at 8pm ET! We’ll discuss impeachment being over, liberal anger and why YouTube is censoring my senate floor speeches! Great show, tune in! @WattersWorld http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EQ10nTlUwAEUT_j.jpg
@EdgarFloresNV @BroadacresMEC Thank you so much for walking me around @BroadacresMEC, @EdgarFloresNV! I’m proud to partner with you to ensure that every Nevada family has the opportunity to thrive.

Giant corporations have proven they’d rather cut corners and push consumers into fighting each other than lose even a penny in profits—and that’s why we’re fighting for big, structural change. https://twitter.com/theferocity/status/1228728828685684736 QT @theferocity This brings to mind Elizabeth Warren noting that corporations want us to argue over straws rather than insist on industry-wide reform. https://twitter.com/tmz/status/1228352584689172480

When General Electric outsources jobs, it raves about China.

When GE wants to pay $0 in taxes for eight straight years, or needs a $16 billion bailout, it doesn't talk about China.

GE goes to the taxpayers of the United States for its welfare checks. https://amp.twimg.com/v/afc876c6-732e-4f79-a854-847f5c23f194

Many of my colleagues believe we should throw more money into our bloated $740 billion military budget—more than the next ten nations combined. 

I say, let us invest in our youth. 

Let us protect our seniors.

Let us repair our crumbling infrastructure.

We will continue protecting immigrant families, our workers, our communities, a woman’s right to choose, Social Security, Medicare and Medicaid.

We will continue fighting to root out corruption and for a government that works for the public interest—not for the special interest. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1228748815542386689/pu/img/XY2uJbcGbIcQsMMU.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1228748815542386689/pu/vid/350x270/4qaQQYD0xuC3pt6I.mp4?tag=10

“Senator Sanders recognizes that we need a movement that is not simply great policies that are going to get us to the society we want, but rather we need to build up a movement.” -@DarrickHamilton http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1228724587233456128/img/j76eIr-joncM7z3x.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1228724587233456128/vid/480x270/s_TpjrSqQ4eA0BHm.mp4?tag=13

I'm proud to support @FairFightAction's fight to protect our reproductive rights and our elections! https://twitter.com/gwlauren/status/1228443210760048640 QT @gwlauren So first, we want to thank @amyklobuchar, @ewarren, @KamalaHarris and @SenGillibrand for taking part in our campaign to support reproductive rights and fight the abortion bans that moved in GA and around the country. 3/8

https://twitter.com/staceyabrams/status/1129794118832599041

Trump and his administration continue to chip away at protections for our public lands. But we won’t let that happen without a fight.

Earlier this week my three bills to protect over 1 million acres of California lands passed in the House. It’s now on the Senate to do the same.

The world's richest 1% have over twice the wealth of 6.9 billion people.

The planet will not be secure or peaceful when so few have so much and so many have so little. https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/20/oxfam-worlds-billionaires-richer-than-a-combined-4point6-billion-people.html

In one week Nevada will go to caucus, and together our job is to make sure turnout breaks a record. Trump's agenda of terrorizing our immigrant neighbors is shameful. It is not what this country is about. Many colleges hire for-profit companies to secretly run their online classes, and most students have no idea that the majority of their tuition $$$ might be flowing right into the pockets of these rich companies. @SenSherrodBrown and I want answers. https://www.insidehighered.com/news/2020/02/05/online-program-management-companies-face-washington-microscope

This week my colleagues and I introduced the Gun Records Restoration and Preservation Act. Besides helping keep our communities safe, this bill would allow researchers to study gun violence and its impact for the first time. It’s critical we act.

“U.S. Sen. Rand Paul and U.S. Rep. Brett Guthrie of Kentucky worked alongside McConnell to persuade Army officials that Fort Knox was the best choice.” https://www.courier-journal.com/story/news/politics/2020/02/14/mitch-mcconnell-celebrated-key-securing-army-hq-fort-knox/4754106002/

But good news is we may get a second shot at it.

Gwen Ifill was the first Black woman to moderate a vice-presidential debate, a leader on PBS’ Washington Week in Review, and a trailblazer in journalism. She deserves to be honored this month and every month. #BlackHistoryMonth
